title: Local obituary: Susan Hurley, 62, former Patriots cheerleader who founded CharityTeams
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Susan Hurley, born in North Reading, was a former Patriots cheerleader and founder of CharityTeams.
Hurley's CharityTeams raised $42 million for nonprofits, focusing on training Boston Marathon charity runners.
Passed away at 62, Susan Hurley is celebrated for her philanthropy and personal impact on her community.

title: Market Basket launches its own beer — here’s where to buy it
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Market Basket launched 'More For Your Dollar' lager collaborating with Zero Gravity Beer.
The 12-pack lager costs $12.99, available at select MB Spirits and MB Beer & Wine stores.
Available locations include Massachusetts, Maine, and New Hampshire Market Basket outlets.

title: As SJC mulls involvement in public defender work stoppage, here’s where things stand
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court considers involvement in public defender pay disputes amid ongoing work stoppage.
Legislature's modest pay increase for public defenders failed to resolve work stoppage, leaving 900 defendants without representation.
Trial court argues judicial intervention in public defender pay could disrupt government balance; SJC justices express hesitance.

title: Reese Witherspoon visits Boston bookstore
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Reese Witherspoon visited Beacon Hill Books and Cafe in Boston for a private dinner and book signing.
Witherspoon signed copies of her debut novel, 'Gone Before Goodbye,' co-authored with Harlan Coben.
She spoke at Harvard Business School, sharing insights from her career and reflecting on 'Legally Blonde.'

title: GOP lawmakers pushing Healey for info on aide arrested in cocaine bust
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: LaMar Cook, an aide to Governor Maura Healey, was arrested for cocaine trafficking, prompting scrutiny of state hiring practices.
Republican lawmakers question Healey's vetting process, citing Cook's past criminal charges, and demand transparency in his hiring details.
GOP gubernatorial candidates call for independent investigations, criticizing Healey's administration over the handling of Cook's arrest.

title: 2 teens killed in New Bedford crash identified
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Gabriel Bertolino Siqueira, 17, and Anne Urbanski Santos De Carvalho, 15, died in a New Bedford crash.
The accident occurred on Route 140 South, involving a 2019 Honda Civic that went off the road.
The crash investigation is ongoing; an 18-year-old driver from Dartmouth survived with non-life-threatening injuries.

title: BPD releases multiple photos of baseball-capped commercial burglary suspect
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police are seeking help identifying a suspect in commercial burglaries starting in late August.
Suspect reportedly used a pry tool to access downtown businesses, stealing credit cards, cash, and electronics.
Police released photos to assist in identifying the man; tips can be reported at 617-343-4571.

title: Report: Mike Vrabel’s former team was ‘unwilling’ to trade with Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Titans owner Amy Adams Strunk reportedly refused trades with the Patriots due to past issues with coach Mike Vrabel.
The Patriots made no major trade deadline deals despite initial interest in Titans' RB Tony and other players.
Tennessee, 1-8 this season, previously fired Vrabel after a 6-11 season, leading to his hiring by the Patriots.

title: Following a career night, Josh Minott isn’t taking his starting role for granted
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Josh Minott scored a career-high 21 points, leading the Celtics to a 136-107 win over the Wizards.
Minott joined the Celtics from the Timberwolves, where he averaged 2.3 points in three seasons.
Despite his rising status, Minott remains humble, focused on maintaining his starting role with Boston.

title: Are the New England Patriots back? Here’s what 200 readers said.
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Readers are divided on the Patriots' performance with 43% optimistic and 44% saying it's too early to tell.
Quarterback Drake Maye is making a significant impact, and coach Mike Vrabel is praised for managing the young team.
Despite the six-game win streak, some fans attribute the success to a weak schedule and remain cautious.
